CatDescriptText: Mr. George Grisham, 7226 Race Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 25, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that business and employment are as good as the Eisenhower administration declares that it is?" answer reads: "Lately, I've read that conditions are better this year. I'm not in a position to say yes or no, but I don't think that they are.  The reason is that I've been laid off several months and have been on and off in my working.  I get laid off for two weeks and it takes me one month to catch up."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of George Grisham wearing light colored hat with dark band and light colored jacket, standing with right hand in pocket in front of vacant lot with trees
